This guide walks through setting up the essential tools for lab work.

## R Environment

### Install R and RStudio

1. Download R from [CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org/)
2. Download [RStudio Desktop](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/)

### Essential Packages

```r
# Core packages
install.packages(c(
  "data.table",
  "targets",
  "tarchetypes",
  "crew",
  "here",
  "yaml"
))

# For clinical trial work
install.packages(c(
  "survival",
  "DiceKriging",
  "lhs"
))
```

### Package Management

Document your package dependencies in your project's README or DESCRIPTION file:

```r
# Save session info for reproducibility
writeLines(capture.output(sessionInfo()), "session_info.txt")
```

## Git and GitHub

### Install Git

- **Mac**: `brew install git` or Xcode Command Line Tools
- **Windows**: [Git for Windows](https://gitforwindows.org/)
- **Linux**: `sudo apt install git`

### Configure Git

```bash
git config --global user.name "Your Name"
git config --global user.email "your.email@unc.edu"
```

### SSH Key Setup

```bash
# Generate SSH key
ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "your.email@unc.edu"

# Start ssh-agent
eval "$(ssh-agent -s)"
ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_ed25519

# Copy public key
cat ~/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub
# Paste into GitHub Settings → SSH Keys
```

### Clone Lab Repos

```bash
# Clone a template
git clone git@github.com:rashid-lab/template-research-project.git my-project
cd my-project
```

## Longleaf (UNC HPC)

### Request Access

1. Go to [ITS Research Computing](https://help.rc.unc.edu/request-a-cluster-account/)
2. Request Longleaf access
3. Wait for approval email (~1-2 days)

### Connect

```bash
# SSH to Longleaf
ssh your_onyen@longleaf.unc.edu

# Or use VS Code Remote SSH extension
```

### Module System

```bash
# List available modules
module avail

# Load R
module load r/4.3.0

# Load commonly used modules
module load r/4.3.0 gcc/11.2.0
```

### Shared Lab Resources

```bash
# Lab project space
cd /proj/rashidlab/

# Add to .Rprofile to use shared package library
# .libPaths(c("/proj/rashidlab/R-packages", .libPaths()))
```

## Quarto

We use Quarto for manuscripts and documentation.

### Install

Download from [quarto.org](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/)

### Verify Installation

```bash
quarto --version
quarto check
```

### Render a Document

```bash
# PDF output
quarto render paper.qmd --to pdf

# HTML output
quarto render paper.qmd --to html
```

## VS Code (Optional)

If you prefer VS Code over RStudio:

### Recommended Extensions

- R Extension for Visual Studio Code
- Quarto
- GitLens
- Remote - SSH (for Longleaf)

### Settings

```json
{
  "r.bracketedPaste": true,
  "r.rterm.linux": "/usr/bin/R",
  "editor.formatOnSave": true
}
```
